definition: to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: They were a quiet and fond couple.
sentences.chinese: 他們夫婦一向和和睦睦，相親相愛。

sentences.english: They love each other, living in fairyland.
sentences.chinese: 他們相親相愛，生活如在仙境。

sentences.english: Hui and Rong fell in love with each other. His lower body became completely paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 輝和蓉相親相愛，但自從輝受傷後，下半身完全癱瘓。

sentences.english: We wake up to find that we were dear to eachother.
sentences.chinese: 我醒了，卻知道我們原是相親相愛的。

sentences.english: Dear to each other in the USA, let a person infinite memories, good happiness.
sentences.chinese: 相親相愛的留影讓人無限回憶，美好了幸福。

sentences.english: They promise to love and cherish each other until death do them part.
sentences.chinese: 他們發誓相親相愛，至死不渝。

sentences.english: Blondie and Dagwood love each other.
sentences.chinese: 勃朗黛和大梧相親相愛。

sentences.english: They were in love, but getting married was complicated.
sentences.chinese: 他們相親相愛，但是談婚配嫁娶可沒那麼簡單。

sentences.english: we wake up to find that we were dear to each other.
sentences.chinese: 我們醒了，卻知道我們原是相親相愛的。

sentences.english: Dry bread is better with love than friend chicken with fear and trembling.
sentences.chinese: 相親相愛喫乾麪包勝過心驚膽戰喫油炸雞。

sentences.english: We wake up to find that we were dear to eath other.
sentences.chinese: 我們醒了，卻知道我們原是相親相愛。

sentences.english: Yong-tie the knot, BizArt Shuangfei, love each other.
sentences.chinese: 永結同心，比翼雙飛，相親相愛。

sentences.english: She was only 17 years old and she and Charlie had fallen deeply in love.
sentences.chinese: 她才17歲卻與查理相親相愛，難捨難分。

definition: (to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
affectionate/intimate/warmhearted/to get intimate with sb
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
inseparable (as form and shadow)
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
to quarrel/to bicker/glib repartee
to get married
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to have a grudge against
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
intimate
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
